LASER ROOM - LONG SHOT                                  73 of two white-suited figures visible through a network of two white- suited figures visible through a network of white scaffolding that encloses the giant laser structure. They are standing on a cherry- picker crane at the second story level of the laser, with a box of tools at their feet. We TRUCK DOWN THE SIDE of the laser, along the tubes which house the amplifying lenses, and MOVE UP, gradually getting close enough to hear what they are saying, and get a look at them. We see that the figures are a young, dark-haired, beautiful woman, with her hair tied back under a hard hat, and an older man, who is using a tool on a section of the laser, and is also wearing a hard hat. The woman is LORA and the man is DR. WALTER GIBBS. He's wearing a copper bracelet above his digital watch/calculator, and has an intense, almost insane look to his dark eyes, with their bristling white eyebrows. In contrast, Lora seems more serious and conservative, but she defers to Gibbs as a senior, and more accomplished, scientist. Both have protective eye goggles -- worn loosely around their necks at the moment. As the CRANE LOWERS THEM to the floor:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They step off the crane and walk to a short, lead-shielded cylindrical PLATFORM, on which rests a solid SPHERE of clear plastic polymer, about 3 inches in diameter. The "firing" end of the giant laser is aimed straight at the sphere. Five feet away is an identical plat-form -- empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She crosses to a COMPUTER CONSOLE nearby. The console is connected to the laser by a few dozen wires and cables. Pulling her goggles into place over her eyes, she sits at the console. Gibbs, adjusting his goggles, takes a position near the platform bearing the sphere -- safe from the laser, but close enough to watch. 74   ANGLE - LORA                                                 74 She types a series of commands on the computer keyboard.

direction.raw_text: The laser shoots a bolt of blindingly bright LIGHT at the polymer sphere. For a moment, the sphere has the look of a wavering, poorly received television picture -- wobbling lines of dots -- and then it disappears entirely. As Gibbs watches, a Lora works feverishly, the laser pivots to point at the platform a few feet away. A second discharge of LIGHT hits the surface of this platform, and -- like a film-in-reverse of the ball's disappearance -- it is reconstructed, five feet from its original position. When the beam shuts off, Lora rushes to join Gibbs in examining the born-again ball of plastic.

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry -
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sharply) I can't afford to have an independent program monitoring me. Do you have any idea how many outside systems I've gone into? How many programs I've appropriated?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nods) It's my fault. I programmed you to want so much...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And I was planning to hit the Pentagon next week...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Pentagon?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It shouldn't be any harder than General Motors was. But now...this is what I get for using humans.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now, wait a minute -- I wrote you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've gotten 2,415 times smarter since then.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you want with the Pentagon?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The same thing I want with the Kremlin. I'm bored with corporations. With the information I can access, I can run things
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: to 1200 times better than any human.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you think -
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You wouldn't want me to dig up Flynn's file and read it up on a VDT at the New York Times, would you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You wouldn't dare.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So do as I tell you. Keep that Tron program out of the system. And get me those Chinese language program I asked for. End of line.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sighs) Well, here goes nothing ...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hah. Interesting, interesting. You hear what you said? "Here goes nothing."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I meant -
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Whereas actually, what we propose to do is to turn something into nothing and back again. So you might just as well have said, "Here goes something and here comes nothing." Hah?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let me make sure we're running
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Looks good...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Let 'er rip... 75   LASER LAB - AS BEFORE                                        75
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) Perfect.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Beautiful!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hello, Alan.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Boy, I sit up there grindin' away all day, and you guys are down here disintegrating things and having fun.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not disintegrating, Alan -- digitizing. While the laser is dismantling the molecular structure of the object, the computer maps out a holographic model of it. The molecules themselves are suspended in the laser beam. Then the computer reads the model back out, the molecules go back into place, and... (indicates ball) voila. 75   CONTINUED                                                    75 ALAN Great. Can it send me to Hawaii?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes...but you have to go roundtrip, and you must purchase your program at least 30 days in advance. Hah!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How's it going upstairs?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Frustrating. I had Tron almost ready to run, and Dillinger cut everybody with Group 7 access out of the system.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Ever since he got that Master Control Program set up, system's got more bugs than a bait store.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, you have to expect some static. Computers are just machines after all, they can't think...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They'll start to soon enough.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (wryly) Yes, won't that be grand -- the computers will start thinking, and people will stop. Lora, I'm going to stay and run some data through. See you tomorrow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To warn him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That Dillinger's on to him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For being on to Dillinger.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (completely confused) What -- ?

direction.name: direction

On another screen, we see statements of ICOM's wealth adding up, accounts receivable and assets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly, before Flynn can go on, the gigantic laser mechanism behind him sends a brilliant beam of LIGHT directly at him. He freezes. We see his body beginning to break into scan lines, like a video image -- the same thing that happened to Gibbs' polymer ball. We can see the terminal also glowing in the intense light, being scanned by the laser. The colors change, become monochromatic - with Flynn's body glowing orange - and the image of his figure blurs and becomes indistinct. ZOOM IN on Flynn and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 129  THE CAMERA RUSHING over a circuit pattern, like the one      129 we saw at the opening of the film'. The pattern changes, dissolving into another image and we are rushing forward at great speed. We see the circuits rushing by and getting larger and then the picture dissolves into darkness with a glowing, spinning globe beneath us, like the globe from AIC's logo, covered with circuits. We are rushing at it, circling it, diving closer and closer, so that the detail on the globe becomes clearer with every second and we realize that the circuits are structures, angular towers and buildings, huge mechanical looking mountains and deserts covered with a glowing grid pattern. Everything glows with an internal energy. We continue diving, down, down, faster and faster and we see the structures of one city-like area across electronic mesas and cliffs, and then we're right over this area and diving straight down, everything blurring with the speed. DISSOLVE TO: 130  ELECTRONIC WORLD - A TUNNEL                                  130 made up of rings of energy, and we are diving straight down it. CUT TO: 131  THIS TUNNEL                                                  131 We see a human figure falling feet first down this tunnel from the outside, and suddenly we're at the bottom, and the figure stops, staggering from the force of the fall, but upright. CUT TO: 132  SHOT OF THE BOTTOM OF THE TUNNEL                             132 We see Flynn, or what looks like Flynn -- same face, etc, but now covered with a strange costume, made of electronic circuitry, glowing with energy. Flynn shakes his head dazedly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Have you been sneaking into the
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: system?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Flynn!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Touche, honey. Yeah, I've been doing a little hacking here. Which I've got every reason, as you well know...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You did break in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tried to. (nods toward terminal) Can't quite make the connection with that sucker, though. If I had a direct terminal ...

dialogue.raw_text: Are you embezzling?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Sydney Greenstreet) "Embezzling" is such an ugly word, Mister Bailey... (normal voice) No, actually I'm trying to get a legal brief together.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't get it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Lora) You haven't told him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (CONT.) (sighs) Sherman, set the Wayback Machine for...oh, 1973. Kevin Flynn (points to himself) is one of the brightest young software engineers at ICOM. He's so bright that he starts going in there at night, and sets up a private memory file, and begins writing a program for a video game he is inventing, called... (waves at one of the games in the room) ...Space Paranoids.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You invented Space Paranoids?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yepper. And Vice Squad, and Meltdown... whole slew of 'em. I was this close (gestures) to starting my own little enterprise. But: enter Ed Dillinger. Another software engineer -- not so young, not so bright, but very, very sneaky. One night, our boy Flynn goes to his terminal, tries to read up his file, and ... nothing. A big blank. We now take you to three months later. Ed Dillinger presents ICOM with five video games he has "invented" -- the slime didn't even change the names -- and he gets a big fat promotion. Thus begins his meteoric rise to...what is he now, Executive V.P.?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Senior exec.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh my. Meanwhile, kids are putting eight million quarters a week in Space Paranoids machines and I'm not seeing one dime.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I still don't get why you're trying to break into the system.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because somewhere... in one of those memories ... is the evidence. If I got in far enough, I could reconstruct it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (CONT.) My password ... Dillinger's instruction to divert the data ...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm afraid it's a little late for that. Dillinger's shut off Group 7 access. He must know what you're up to.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Boy, I bet I know who's workin' late tonight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dillinger?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. Tryin' to find the file and erase it. Once that's gone, ain't nothin' can stop him. Just Eddie and his Master Control Program, runnin' things from on high..
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't even say that. You've got to find that file before he does..
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not much chance of that now. The MCP can just slip it into another system as soon as it locates it...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not if my Tron program was running. That would seal the system off. If your file's in there...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Boy, if we were inside, I know how to forge us a Group 6 access...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shall we dance?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ed, all I'm saying is - if our own people can't get access to their programs ... you know how frustrating it is, when you're working on a piece of research -
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Walter, I sympathize, but I have data coming out of the Master Control Program saying there is something screwy -- GIBBS That MCP, you know, that's half the problem right -- DILLINGER The MCP is the most efficient way of handling what we do. I can't sit and worry about every little user request that -- GIBBS User requests are what computers are for.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Doing our business is what computers are for. Look, Walter, with all respect -- ICOM isn't the business you started in your garage anymore --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (CONT.) We're billing accounts in 30 countries, we've got one of the largest systems in existence...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, I know all that. Sometimes I wish I was back in that garage...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It can be arranged...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That was uncalled-for.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry, Walt. So much pressure lately... you feel like going for a drink?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you, no. I have some work to do... assuming I can still log on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You better get in back with Flynn. And keep down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do I gotta?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (resigned) Hi, Flynn.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (explaining) My dinner.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was wondering where you got that glow of good health.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Want one?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh... got any cinnamon?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Keep it down, you guys. 104  EXT. ICOM - THE GIGANTIC SECURITY ENTRANCE - NIGHT
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't think I'm cleared for this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm certainly not.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Move aside. Let the kid have some room.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay ... Flynn, I'm gonna put you at my terminal, down in the laser lab. We'll be up in Alan's office.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Swell...I'll log us both on, and you can get your Tron thing running...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: As long as we stay off the top floor, Dillinger'll never know we've been in here... 106  POV SECURITY CAMERA                                          106
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This laser's my life's work. Don't spill anything.

They turn another corner and come to the edge of a gaping ravine. Several hundred feet to their left a narrow bridge connects their ledge with another canyon wall, and a wider ledge, which leads down to the floor of the entire area, and on to freedom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The tanks are following through the maze, smooth gray automatons, lifeless, inexorable nemesis. Tron's cycle is in the lead as all three race for the bridge, but behind them, we see the first tank turning the corner.

direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the building Tron was eyeing when we left him. We see him inside now, in a corridor, passing a large opening which gives views of partially completed structures: an aircraft carrier, a strange elongated craft that resembles a sailboat on its side. All composed partially of glowing lines, and partially of flat smooth surfaces. We see several female programs working in these rooms. This building only has female workers, but they are all pale and listless, no interest in anything, staring at their feet as they shuffle along. Tron looks farther down the corridor.
direction.name: direction

YORI'S APARTMENT                                        314 As Tron and Yori enter. The apartment appears to be a box, with one window overlooking the cityscape, and the I/0 Tower. At first it looks empty, with strange murals of one dimensional furniture on the walls and floors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She lays her palm on the wall near the door. The door reappears, and a glow starts to fill the room, softly, slowly. Tron looks around; the flat paintings of furniture are expanding, filling out, becoming three-dimensional. The room glows a soft rose color, becomes charming, soothing. It is still small and limited, but the light in the air and the few pieces of furniture give off a loving, seductive aura. Tron turns back to Yori, smiling, and stops. 315  HIS POV                                                      315 With her hand still on the wall panel, she is glowing absorbing extra energy, changing. The severe work clothes metamorphosize into shimmering, diaphanous drapery, twinkling with thousands of diamond-like points of light. A silvery tinkling SOUND comes from her robes as she moves forward; her beautiful face, now surrounded by a soft mane of hair, glows with pleasure at the expression in Tron's face. She smiles lovingly, and reaches out her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His face tells the story. The fugitive, returned from long exile, is being fully rewarded for his efforts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as their hands touch, and the glow springs out between their flattened palms. Tron pulls her close to him, sliding his hand up her arm, leaving a glowing trace, and her hands move up over his chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They move together into an embrace, but their lips never touch. All the energy is transmitted through their hands. They sink down onto what looks like cushions made of stars, their glow increasing. The room fills with the brilliance of the energy they are giving each other, and we hear their sighs, as the MUSIC comes up. Each of them moves their hands over the other, moving slowly, as if they were trying to touch the other's entire body at once. They roll over and are enveloped in the cloud of stars...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tron and Yori are crossing an open plaza-like area, on their way to the I/0 Tower. They pass by more zombie-like programs and overhear bits of conversation, all in dead-sounding monotones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It looms high overhead. 330  TRON AND YORI                                                330 on a long curving walkway which encircles the base of the Tower, approaching a wide door in the wall. 331  INSIDE THIS DOOR'                                            331 We see that it opens onto a wide elevator platform, which is now rising upwards at a steep angle, carrying Tron and Yori smoothly and silently towards an opening in a floor a hundred feet overhead. 332  SHOT FROM BELOW THEM                                         332 looking upwards as they move. 333  THE UPPER FLOOR                                              333 as the elevator platform arrives, and they step off. We get the sense of massive, over-size ceilings, floors, windows and machinery, dwarfing the programs who come to the Tower to communicate, preparing them for the experience, as a vaulting cathedral prepared the sinner for confession. But here, everything is composed of clean, sharp, angular surfaces.  On this second story there is floor and ceiling, but no outer wall, so we can still see the city-grid below and beyond. Tron and Yori cautiously move forward across the floor, heading for a door into the inner parts of the Tower. 334-349 OMIT                                                         334-349 350  THE CENTRAL CHAMBER                                          350 of the I/0 Tower. A large, raised circular altar stands against one wall, with a darkened opening behind it. A square, secondary altar supports the first, about fifty feet up a side. In the middle of the altar we see a structure of stacked, diminishing steps, the final one forming the shoulders of an armless, padded suit with a puffed headdress revealing the face of the I/0 Tower priest, DUMONT. His eyes are shut. His face is lined with age, but still holds a sprightly sensitivity. It is the face of Dr. Gibbs, from the laser lab in the Real world. There is a large, V-shaped opening behind the altar, and the circular steps glow a hot neon, each a different color. The stripes of color thus formed bleed upwards onto the wall, lining either side of the V opening. There is only blackness beyond. 351  DUMONT'S FACE                                                351 asleep. 352  REVERSE ANGLE                                                352 Tron and Yori walk toward him from an entranceway across the wide room, their footsteps ECHOING. 353-374 OMIT                                                         353-374 375  CENTRAL CHAMBER - TRON, YORI, DUMONT                         375 Tron and Yori stop at the foot of Dumont's altar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The priest's eyes flicker open. He looks at Tron and Yori, doesn't recognize either one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tron steps closer, speaks quietly to Dumont.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He pauses, sizing Tron up, considering it. Finally:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dumont nods, and the neon glow fades a little.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tron runs lightly up the steps, past Dumont, into the darkness beyond.

dialogue.raw_text: I have to re-route the insurance information bits... Next cycle we start the war game simulation for the MCP... Did you make that accounts receivable adjustment for Sark... dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) Dumont... ?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nervous) I... have come to communicate with my User.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hmm. A difficult proposition... difficult proposition at best. (indicates empty chamber) Perhaps you've noticed... we're not exactly packing them in these days ...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes...what--?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know, not so long ago, you could've come in here and seen programs lined up all the way back to those doors, waiting for communion with their Users. The building fund was doing well too...but now... (sighs) ...this so-called Master Control Program is going around cutting programs off from their natural creators, grabbing all our believers and making them ride around on little motor scooters and shoot things at each other and Weiner knows what all-- oh, it's enough to give you a crisis of faith...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well I want to communicate -- DUMONT Oh, you want to -- hah. I could get myself de-rezzed just-for letting you in here. They hate this tower. They'd close it down if they dared to but they keep me around, in case one of them wants to deal with the other world once in a while. And you should hear the way they commune! Sounds like they were routing a payroll, for all the heart they put in it. No, I don't think you
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dumont... my User has information that could -- could make this a free system again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hah.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Really. You'd have programs lined up around the block to use this place -- and no MCP looking over your shoulder.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sighs) When you've been in the system as long as I have, you hear many promises... many reassurances...many brave plans...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (CONT.) (falling into ritual) Who is your User, program?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: N TO REVEAL the laser pouring its light onto the floor, near the chair where Flynn was sitting when he was digitized. Slowly -- in a reverse of his disappearance -- Flynn's BODY takes shape on the floor. As the laser shuts off, he is revealed intact -- back in his real-world body and clothes... and as bewildered to find himself here as he was when he first arrived in the electronic world. He studies his hands -- and SEES that they're now nonluminescent flesh and blood. He looks out the window and SEES that it's shortly past dawn, with weak sunlight coming in. And, at the SOUND of light MACHINERY at work, he turns to look at Lora's computer terminal, where a hard-copy computer PRINTER is coughing out a long document on wide blue paper. Flynn gets up off the floor, goes over to the printer, and READS the document. As he does so, his eyes widen, and a SMILE appears on his face. The printer finishes its run, clicks patiently. Flynn, exuberant, tears the printout from the machine and rushes to the door with it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 634  INT. ALAN'S OFFICE - ALAN AND LORA                           634 Bleary but excited, they gaze happily at the information on Alan's
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: screen as Flynn bursts into the room, waving his printout.

direction.raw_text: Before he can say anything more, Alan turns to greet him, holding up a seven-inch computer software FLOPPY DISK in its cardboard sleeve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alan and Lora look at him -- the same sort of mystified look he got from Tron and Yori in the other world. He checks himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He shows them the printout. It takes Alan and Lora a few seconds of reading it to figure out its significance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Flynn folds up the printout, puts it in his pocket. Alan and Lora get up, stretch, start wandering slowly toward the door with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As they talk, CAMERA PANS over to Alan's color CRT SCREEN and HOLDS on it. 635  CRT SCREEN                                                   635 The lines of printed information that had filled it up wipe off, and are replaced by a number of shapes very much like the ones in a typical video game:
